home.status: Status: Soon in apprenticeship for the title of Application Developer Designer at Motoblouz (beginning October 2025)
home.description1: A geek at heart, I've always loved understanding how the digital world works.
home.description2: In September 2024, I joined Wild Code School to dive into web development. With my degree in hand, I'm ready to continue exploring and transforming ideas into concrete projects.
home.description3: My career before coding ? It shaped me. As a Gendarme Adjoint Volontaire (French military police), I learned discipline, cohesion, and responsibility. Then, in logistics and e-commerce, I developed my ability to adapt, organize, and see beyond my own mission.
home.description4: Today, I combine this varied experience with my passion for digital to build useful, creative and effective solutions.

skills.title: Skills
skills.description: An overview of the technologies I was able to learn, explore and practice

projects.title: Projects
projects.description2: Projects that allowed me to progress, test, and consolidate my skills

projectsCard.title: Z Warriors Clicker
projectsCard.description: An incremental game set in the Dragon Ball universe, where players click to accumulate power, unlock powerful transformations and techniques, and defeat iconic enemies.

projectsCard.title: Code Quest Academy
projectsCard.description: An interactive educational game that combines investigation and learning, where players take on the role of a web development student, solving puzzles to master HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other technologies.

projectsCard.title: Legodex
projectsCard.description: An application for cataloging LEGO collections. This individual final-year project aimed to create a complete web application, from design to completion, in 48 hours.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description1: A question, feedback, or just want to chat about tech ?
contact.description2: Do not hesitate to contact me!
